Entries.default:
<ispeech>What is this, [Player Race]-creature?</ispeech> The vithrack cocks its head and focuses its many eyes on you.

Its strange companions also stare at you with unnatural intensity.
The creature's probing psyche traces a question in your mind. Its strange companions stand perfectly still, waiting.
"Your snooping has upset some of your neighbors."
"Tell me what you know about Ernezzo."
"What are you doing in the Gullet?"
"I need supplies."
"Farewell."

The vithrack drops her mind like a toy it has grown bored with.

It turns its attention to yours. 

You feel it shuffling through your thoughts as though it were turning pages in a book.
<ispeech>We have no interest in the woman or her petty fears.</ispeech> One of the vithrack's mouthparts flicks up to clean its eyes.
<ispeech>We dig! There are many minds here with many secrets. Many depths with even more.</ispeech>

Images arise in your mind. Memories.

You see Pitli, stifling her coughs as she tells you about the drowner's lung medicine.

And you see Ernezzo.
[Shield your mind.]
[Muster your willpower against the vithrack.]
"Stop it!"
[Let the vithrack explore your thoughts.]

You push the vithrack out, and your mind clears for one blissful moment. 

Then, the creature squirms past your defenses and renews its invasion.
"We must see! We must know!"

The vithrack delves deeper.

It sees you in Ernezzo's shop, talking to the merchant. You ask about the drowner's lung medicine, and Ernezzo begins to answer.

The vithrack chitters with interest.
[Drive the vithrack out of your mind.]
"Get out of my head!"
[Let the vithrack explore your thoughts.]

You hurl your own powers against the vithrack, finally pushing the creature out of your mind. 

It staggers back, mandibles spasming in frustration.

The elf rubs her head, wincing.

You concentrate and draw your mind into a smooth, blank pane, as still as an iced-over lake.

You gently draw your thoughts beneath it, where the vithrack cannot reach them.

The creature screeches with annoyance. One of the ogres echoes the sound with a gravelly roar.
"We only wish to know!"

It continues pushing into your memory, gentle but determined.

Your conversation with Ernezzo plays out.

He tells you about the Spindle Man and offers the medicine to you in exchange for killing him.

The vithrack eases out of your mind.
<ispeech>What is your business with the seller-woman?</ispeech> Its eyes twitch with curiosity. Its associates stare at you, unblinking.
"Enough. My secrets are mine to keep."
"You saw the memory. I've got nothing to hide."
[Attack] "This is nothing personal."
"Ernezzo wants me to kill you in exchange for a rare medicine."
<ispeech>Yes. But we know the Ernesso-woman plots against us. We hear her whisper it in her thoughts.</ispeech>

<ispeech>Yes. We saw it is the medicine you desire.

So we will tell you a secret.</ispeech> It nearly dances with excitement, tapping its curved claws together.

The elf sways and claps softly.
<ispeech>You tell us a secret freely? What a rare thing. A wondrous thing.</ispeech>
<ispeech>Yes, this Ernesso speaks little to us, but her thoughts say much. We know she plots against us.</ispeech>

<ispeech>But as long as her assassins are so transparent, we will have ample warning.</ispeech> 

You feel the vithrack's satisfaction like a warm glow.

<ispeech>But you, you do not care about Ernesso. Only the medicine.

Let us tell you an excellent secret.</ispeech> It nearly dances with excitement, tapping its curved claws together.

The elf sways and claps softly.

<ispeech>But you know how to hide a secret. So we will tell you one.</ispeech> It nearly dances with excitement, tapping its curved claws together.

The elf sways and claps softly.
<ispeech>If you also exterminate her, then we can sell you special things. At special prices.</ispeech> Its mouthparts clack and tap with glee.
<ispeech>There is a hidden entrance to her storeroom.</ispeech> Its eyes flash and flicker.
<ispeech>Now that the cagey one is gone, many more come to us. We have many things to sell. Many things to see.</ispeech>
The vithrack reaches further into your mind, plucking and picking at your memories.
<ispeech>A Watcher. The Dyrwood. The great empire of Aedyr.</ispeech>
"I don't want you in my head."
"Let's talk instead - why don't you ask me what you want to know?"
"Go ahead. I've got nothing to hide."
"Get out or I'll end you!"
[Do nothing.]
The vithrack withdraws, grinding one of its mandibles peevishly.

"What secrets does it bring?"

You feel a gentle scratching in your head.

Another voice speaks directly into your mind.
"What secrets do you want?"
<ispeech>The language of tongues is a dull, tedious thing.</ispeech> It snaps its mandibles together.
<ispeech>Why ask when you can see for yourself?</ispeech>
"A city under a city."
"Another in the ruins!"

<ispeech>It teems with young secrets - rivalries and betrayals. 

We seek the older secrets, buried deeper and carved on weathered stone.</ispeech>

It chitters in disgust. 

The elf gnashes her teeth.

"His is a small mind with small concerns. What do you care for him? You-"

The elf abruptly falls silent, her mouth still hanging open.
[Attack] "That's enough!"
"Let us see, let us see!"
"Seller-woman?"

<ispeech>The one who calls herself Ernesso.</ispeech>

It waves a claw in impatience, a gesture that is mirrored by one of the ogres.
"Ernezzo is a man."
<ispeech>As you say. We discern no difference.</ispeech>
[Attack] "I've had enough from you!"
<ispeech>But now this is not a secret. Let us speak of another one.</ispeech>

<ispeech>Her thoughts whisper other secrets, too.</ispeech> It nearly dances with excitement, tapping its curved claws together.

The elf sways and claps softly.
<ispeech>What is your secret? Why do you hide your thoughts of the seller-woman from us?</ispeech> Its eyes twitch with curiosity. Its associates stare at you, unblinking.
<ispeech>Though the other seller-women and seller-men might think angry thoughts of you then.</ispeech>
"We hear footsteps."
"Something approaches."
<ispeech>Follow the wooden catwalk east of her shop. This is where she moves supplies in secret for Dereo.</ispeech>
<ispeech>Follow the wooden catwalk east of her shop. This is where she moved supplies in secret for Dereo.</ispeech>
<ispeech>Ernesso sells many things. To common people, but also to powerful criminals who command many.</ispeech>
<ispeech>She is foolish and predictable. We will waste no more time on her.</ispeech>
<ispeech>She fears us. Fears that we will gather and scatter her secrets.</ispeech>
<ispeech>That is why her shop has a secret entrance.</ispeech>
<ispeech>Follow the wooden catwalk east of her shop. This is where she moved supplies in secret for Dereo.</ispeech>
<ispeech>Follow the wooden catwalk east of her shop. This is where she moves supplies in secret for Dereo.</ispeech>
<ispeech>Let us see, let us see.</ispeech> The vithrack clicks its claws together in delight.

<ispeech>Any! All!</ispeech>

It plunges into your thoughts and fumbles for one.
<ispeech>We wish only to see. To know. Yet kith hide and hoard their secrets.</ispeech>
<ispeech>Wanderer! You also explore and seek. Will you deny us?</ispeech> The creature's pleading strikes a sharp, high note in your head.
<ispeech>You seek mysteries and revelations! You also hunger to know.</ispeech> The creature's pleading strikes a sharp, high note in your head.
<ispeech>Your mind tangles and unravels a hundred questions, just to feel their fiber. Will you deny us?</ispeech> The creature's pleading strikes a sharp, high note in your head.
<ispeech>You hoard knowledge! Many facts and details from a life spent learning. Will you deny us?</ispeech> The creature's pleading strikes a sharp, high note in your head.
<ispeech>You picked and puzzled at the mysteries of the natural world. Will you deny us?</ispeech> The creature's pleading strikes a sharp, high note in your head.
<ispeech>Yes, you came to Deadfire seeking knowledge, too.</ispeech>

<ispeech>A death. A life. A wide sea, stirred by storms and pirates and...</ispeech>

Eothas' giant, glowing head surfaces in your mind.
[Wait.]
<ispeech>You also taste the thoughts of other minds. Will you deny us?</ispeech> The creature's pleading strikes a sharp, high note in your head.
<ispeech>You collect many arcane secrets! Their power flows through you. Will you deny us?</ispeech> The creature's pleading strikes a sharp, high note in your head.

<ispeech>Ah, a wonderful secret!</ispeech>

You hear the vithrack clack and rub its mandibles together. It reminds you of a glutton licking his lips.
"Will you tell me a secret?"

"Yes. You have been generous with us."

The ogres nod slowly.
It snaps its mouthparts together in irritation.
<ispeech>Not when you have been such a miser with your own.</ispeech>
<ispeech>There is a place below the slums - old, cold, and abandoned - where the city swallows those it wishes forgotten.</ispeech>
<ispeech>But this place was once part of the city. So was its temple - a site holy to the goddess of distant, forgotten things.</ispeech> Its eyes gleam.
"Why tell me this?"
"I see."

<ispeech>We want to see you betray Ernesso with her own secret.

Take the medicine you desire.</ispeech>

It sidles closer. The ogre and the elf also take a couple steps forward, their eyes blank and expressions still.

"Keep your weather eye open, cap. The thought-probing ain't much to worry over, but I'll be a two-headed ogre if that's the only trick up them silk sleeves."

Serafen scrutinizes the vithrack.
Meanwhile, the vithrack scrabbles and slithers deeper into your mind.
"Fine, I'll tell you a secret."
"Very well."
<ispeech>Yes?</ispeech> It chitters excitedly.
"I'm not really left-handed."
"On second thought, let me think about it some more."
"The gods were created by the Engwithans."
[Lie] "I've never been wrong about anything in my life."

"Easy ahead, cap. You might leave be your usual inventiveness. This time."

He frowns at the vithrack.
"I was nearly killed by Eothas and restored by Berath."
[Shield your mind.]
It seizes on another thought.
"Serafen, get this creature out of my head!"

"Aye-aye, captain!" The room shudders as the orlan's mind crashes into the vithrack's all within your own heaving thoughts.

Like a spider escaping from under a boot, the vithrack's consciousness eludes Serafen and presses deep into you.
"Serafen, help me!"

<ispeech>Shove off now, you fuck-witted, ballast-blowing cockroach!</ispeech> 

Serafen's profanity crashes through your mind, a tumult that tears the vithrack's mental talons from the flesh of your memories, sweeps it up, and sends it hurtling from your consciousness.
"I'm not the one who opened my big mouth."
"I have an honest face. A poor assassin is this handsome fish."
"Of all things! I am most certainly not transparent! "...Am I?" He turns sheepishly to you.
"I don't like these fancy names it's calling us."

"Aye, that's us. Clear as an empty glass."

He winks at you.
"I'll show you transparent, you overgrown tick!"
"I've crushed bigger spiders. Just say the word."
"Look but don't touch, I say."

"All right, I'll go first." 

He clears his throat. "Is it true some of your kind are covered in soft fur that feels good to pet?"

One of the vithrack's eyes shifts toward Edér. After a moment, it shifts back to you.
"A vithrack. Desgante. It's hard to believe they tolerate it, even down here."
"Oh, it's making my skin crawl."
"I assume you're volunteering one of your own." He coughs delicately.

It stops and considers, one fang trembling.

You feel it tasting your thoughts for the truth.

"Yes. You have been generous with us."

The ogres nod slowly.
It squeals. <ispeech>We tire of your games, [Player Race]-creature.</ispeech>
"Lie!"
<ispeech>The Ernesso woman is dead. We see it in your thoughts.</ispeech> The creature's long fingers twitch with joy.
"It's 'Ernezzo.' With Zs."
<ispeech>What is this droning sound? You have a fly in your teeth?</ispeech> Its mandibles jerk with interest.
[Show the medallion.] "Do you know where I could find a buyer for something like this?"
<ispeech>What use have we for silly trinkets? Ernesso would desire such things.</ispeech> It waves it away with a clawed hand.

<ispeech>You seek to know how the other crawlers and scroungers move their trinkets and treasures. 

A most worthy secret.</ispeech> It scrabbles its claws in delight.
It pauses, regarding you with its many unblinking eyes.
The vithrack's attention turns to Tekēhu, who abruptly winces.
<ispeech>No prize secrets in this one. Not like the others with the water-sense.</ispeech>
"We already know about the dragon."
"What?"
"Tekēhu, this mean anything to you?"
<ispeech>Their minds carry secrets of a damp cave. A hateful glare beneath a stagnant pool. A dead woman's regret...</ispeech> The vithrack rolls its eyes back in ecstasy.
"Gibberish! The floating spider had best explain itself."
<ispeech>Yes? What other secrets have you found?</ispeech> The vithrack turns its hungry attention back to you.
<ispeech>Kith hoard many secrets. The best ones they bury deep in their cities, behind mighty walls.</ispeech>
<ispeech>But what secrets fill your mind?</ispeech> The vithrack turns its hungry attention back to you.
<ispeech>They lurk in a place just below us - close to the seller-folk here, but big enough to hide their ships. The Undercroft, they call it.</ispeech>
<ispeech>They descend spider-like from the lift by Ernesso's shop. But many guards there, oh yes.</ispeech>
<ispeech>But there is a secret way.</ispeech> It nods over its folded claws.
[Listen.]
"That's no help!"
"Not for long."
"There's always a back door."
<ispeech>Down the lift from the Gullet, where the punished ones go, and through the ruins of the Old City. Southwest to an old shrine.</ispeech>
<ispeech>Yes.</ispeech> It nods over its folded claws.
<ispeech>There is the secret way to the Undercroft.</ispeech>
<ispeech>But beware - if the slithering, scraping things of the ruins do not kill you, the kithlings of the Undercroft will.</ispeech> Its waggling mouthparts make a rasping, laughing sound.
<ispeech>You know of the place below the slums. There is another, more distant place beneath the sea.</ispeech>
<ispeech>There lies a secret so grand that even the gods hide it! To find such a thing - how marvelous.</ispeech> Its eyes gleam.
<ispeech>The one they call Dereo would know. But she carries many secrets. Rarely welcomes guests.</ispeech>
<ispeech>But she might invite one of sufficient worth. One whose name is known and whispered in these places.</ispeech>
"I don't trust this creature. At all." He eyes the vithrack and looks toward the exit.
The vithrack stumbles back, mandibles clicking in twitching spasms.
<ispeech>A Watcher. The Dyrwood. The warm seas of the Deadfire.</ispeech>
<ispeech>A Watcher. The Dyrwood. The storm-wracked coast of Rauatai.</ispeech>
<ispeech>A Watcher. The Dyrwood. The fertile plains of Ixamitl.</ispeech>
<ispeech>A Watcher. The Dyrwood. The waning power of Old Vailia.</ispeech>
<ispeech>A Watcher. The Dyrwood. The untamed wilds of The Living Lands.</ispeech>
<ispeech>A Watcher. The Dyrwood. The wasteland of the White that Wends.</ispeech>
<ispeech>A Watcher. The Dyrwood. A home left long ago.</ispeech>
<ispeech>She feared us. Feared that we would gather and scatter her secrets. But she fears nothing any longer.</ispeech>
<ispeech>Ernesso sold many things. To common people, but also to powerful criminals who command many.</ispeech>
<ispeech>That is why her shop has a secret entrance.</ispeech>
<ispeech>You extend your hands to the desperate and destitute, and you do not flinch from their filth! Will you deny us?</ispeech> The creature's pleading strikes a sharp, high note in your head.

<ispeech>The low ones call you friend. A knife to the gut, a coin quickly stolen - these acts for you are like breathing. Will you deny us?</ispeech> The creature's pleading strikes a sharp, high note in your head.
<ispeech>You, however, she might desire to meet. Yes. Yes. Your name is known to her, whispered in the corridors.</ispeech>
<ispeech>But your friends, the cutthroats and cut purses of this place, they do not care for the old secrets, they do not!</ispeech>
<ispeech>Your friends, the broken down creatures of this place, they know the old secrets, they know, but they do not tell me!</ispeech>
